direction.raw_text: what bliss. Low-voiced, incisive, and subtle, with Morticia, smiles are rare. The ghostly whiteness of her complexion is offset by the red of the pillowcase upon which her hair is spread like a diabolic halo. A dark Garbo, sultry and remote, she's a ruined beauty. Morticia OPENS HER EYES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Unhappy, darling?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes, yes. Completely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Grandmama. In a foul mood, Granny tromps up into the attic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You kids are going to have to kill your own breakfast this morning. Wednesday opens a cigar box. Inside the box are assorted human and animal teeth, fangs and dentures, along with a collection of glass eyes. Wednesday drops her tooth in the box.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A6 Gomez takes Morticia in his arms. As she languidly drapes herself across his chest, she is caught in a sudden shaft of sunlight. She squints. On the bedside table beside her, Morticia's OVERSIZED CARNIVOROUS ORCHID WILTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez... the sun... il me perce comme un poignard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tish... that's French!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oui.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cara mia! (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 12/3/90                           5. A6   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: En garde monsieur sole! He thrusts and parries, pantomiming a duel with the shaft of light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Querida?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Last night, you were... unhinged. You were like some desperate, howling demon. You frightened me. Do it again. Gomez, instantly aflame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lousy bucket of bolts...! The FOG MACHINE, straight out of a Jules Verne nightmare, is malfunctioning this morning, struggling to churn out its patches of fog.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 7 At the window, Gomez pokes his head out. In the background, Morticia brushes her hair with a silver filigree brush.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Granny - where's your fog? (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/28/90                        5A . 7   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Lurch. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/6/90                           6. 9    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 10 SAME TIME Gomez is HITTING GOLF BALLS -- Thing serving as his tee -- while Morticia sips tea. 11   ONE OF THE GOLF BALLS                                      11 flies with incredible speed THROUGH THE WINDOW of the ADDAMS' ONLY NEIGHBOR. This well-tended HOME sits on the hill overlooking the Addams' Mansion like some Republican sentinel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Damn you, Addams!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 13 FROM THEIR VANTAGE POINT -- it appears to Gomez and Morticia that Judge Womack is waving to them. Gomez waves back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry about the window, Judge! Keep the ball! I have a whole bucketful. He holds up a bucket of golf balls. He tosses his golfclub to Thing, who DEPOSITS IT in the golfbag. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/28/90                            7. 13    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez joins Morticia watching THE DEPARTING SCHOOL BUS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The little ones, off to school. Bless them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They grow up so fast, don't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Too fast. THEIR POV Tires smoking, the school bus strains to chug down the road. Gleefully hanging from the rear bumper is Pugsley, dragging his heels.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A14   OMITTED                                                      A14 B14   INT. THE CONSERVATORY - LATER THAT MORNING                   B14 Morticia, wearing gardening gloves, is snipping the blossoms off her roses. Gomez sits at a table, playing CHESS with Thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a milestone, Tish. This very evening -- our twenty-fifth seance. All those years, gnawed by guilt, undone by woe, burning with uncertainty...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Gomez, don't torture yourself. That's my job.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tish...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Imagine, Darling, if Fester did come back. Half-alive, barely human, a rotting shell...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't tease.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 12/3/90                          8. 14    EXT. JUST OUTSIDE THE ADDAMS' GROUNDS - SAME TIME          14 TULLY ALFORD, the family attorney, and his wife, MARGARET, approach "GATE," a wrought-iron monstrosity that opens of its own accord. Though Tully comes here often and Margaret has been here before, they never cease to be startled by "Gate." Tully has a puffy, once handsome face, and an embittered grey aura that is the mark of a middle-age misspent. High-strung and superficial, Margaret is more disap- pointed in Tully than he is in himself. Margaret passes through Gate first. Then, as Tully passes through, Gate slams on him, clipping him and catching the end of his coat. Tully fights Gate for his coat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me go! Ignoring Tully, Margaret continues stiffly up the walk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme that! Stop it! I'm warning you! It's not a good day!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez moves a chess piece. Thing gestures out the window. Gomez and Morticia both look out. As they do, Thing moves two chess pieces, cheating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tully is here, darling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sing. Dance. Date. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/12/90                          85 . 113   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mother, I'm... I'm so terribly sorry... (he kneels at her side) It was just a party. It's over. It means nothing. Those Siamese twins, that hunchback, Cousin It - they're not you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Say it, Gordon. Make me believe it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I love you.   And I want money.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've got to find Tully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morticia is looking for her children. She discovers Pugsley ASLEEP, curled up on the SILVER PLATTER WHERE THE TWO-HEADED PIG LAY. She finds this enchanting. Gomez enters.   Morticia shushes him; she points to the platter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look - our little boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All tuckered out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So sweet. He looks just... like a little entree. Pugsley wakes up; he looks around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where... where's the party? (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/12/90                          86 . 114   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's over, darling - have you seen your sister?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not since before the Mamushka.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't fret - we'll find her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez rallies the family for the search. Morticia wears a black cloak. Granny has grabbed her divining rod. Lurch distributes torches, then stands aside, awaiting instructions. Pugsley helps Gomez unroll an ancient map of the area.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fan out. Pugsley - head for the dung heap. Mama and Morticia - the shallow graves. I'll take the abyss, and Lurch - check the bottomless pit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Her favorite...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fester!!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up here. They look up at Fester, looking down at them from Wednesday's window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fester! You take the ravine!     And the unmarked, abandoned well!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Somebody should stay behind - in case she comes back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good man!   Good thinking! (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 12/3/90                              87 . 115   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then who'll take the swamp? Thing tugs at the cuff of Gomez's pants.       Gomez nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the spirit, Thing - lend a hand! Let's go! They all sweep off, with Gomez in the lead. 116   INT. WEDNESDAY'S ROOM - A SHORT WHILE LATER                     116 Fester is still at the window.      Abigail joins him. THEIR POV Spread far and wide over the grounds, the various members of the family search for Wednesday, tiny lights aloft, calling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where the hell is Tully? They head out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 117   OMITTED                                                         117 118   INT. DEN - A LITTLE LATER                                       118 Fester and Virginia find... TULLY - sitting in an armchair, basking in the rays of sunshine that beam from a copy of "The Sun Also Rises." Tully smiles at them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Relaxing.   Taking a little sun.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you gone mad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Au contraire. Tully closes the book and smugly unfurls a LEGAL DOCUMENT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/19/91                         88 . 119    EXT. SWAMP - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT                           119 Thing hops lily pads, stopping occasionally to quest the air for his mistress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 120 THE NIGHT Torch aloft, Pugsley searches through the primeval forest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lurch picks up a car -- looking for Wednesday.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 122 Morticia and Granny stand in the middle of the dripping dankness. Stalagmites. Stalactites. Granny's torch casts scary shadows on the cave walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wednesday! Wednesday!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Mama, I was sure we'd find her here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez reaches a stately mausoleum at the far end of the cemetery. Two proud marble vultures guard the entryway. Gomez lowers the uplifted claw of one of the vultures and the stone doors slide open. He steps into - A124   INT. MAUSOLEUM - SAME TIME                                 A124 Inside it is catacomb-like, filled with the bleached bones of the Addams dead. Gomez's torch casts shadows -- one of which belongs to Wednesday, curled asleep on a stone sarcophagus. Relieved to find her, Gomez approaches quietly. He doesn't want to wake her up. He lifts her tenderly in his arms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/15/91                            89 . 124   EXT. GATE - DARKNESS BEFORE DAWN                              124 Gate can't open. He rattles miserably on his hinges -- locked tight with heavy chains and yellow police tape - large "NO TRESPASSING!! COURT ORDER!! ADDAMS FAMILY - KEEP OUT!!" signs are posted on Gate's rusty bars. PULL BACK TO REVEAL -- the family, appalled at the sight of Gate.    Lurch carries the sleeping Wednesday and Pugsley.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's all this? TULLY -- hurries down the walkway, waving his legal document.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is a restraining order, Gomez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A restraining order?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It requires you to keep a distance of one thousand yards from this house. You've got about nine hundred and ninety-nine yards to go - catch my drift?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am restrained - from my own house!?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not your house, moustache! Not any more! It belongs to the eldest living descendant, the older of the brothers
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CYLINDRICAL FLOOR-TO-CEILING FISH TANK, FILLED WITH PIRANHA

dialogue.raw_text: : A3   OMITTED                                                     A3 3    INT. PUGSLEY'S ROOM - SAME TIME                             3 Pugsley crouches on the floor, playing with his kid-sized chemistry set. The walls of his room are covered with road signs he's collected -- "Bridge Out!", "Detour! Excavation Ahead!", "Dangerous Undertow!", "Keep Clear! High Voltage!" SAWED-OFF STOP SIGNS, still on their poles, are stacked in the corner. In another corner stands a CYLINDRICAL FLOOR-TO-CEILING FISH TANK, FILLED WITH PIRANHA. This tubby energetic monster of a nine-year-old boy has every chance of growing up to be the public monster his parents would be proud of. He MIXES chemicals in a beaker. The brew steams.    Grin- ning wickedly, Pugsley SWALLOWS it down. He contorts, undergoing the beginnings of a transforma- tion, then SHRINKS to the size of a mouse. Laughing, he crawls out of his human-size pajamas.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: ONE END OF A STRING TIED TO HER TOOTH, THE OTHER TIED TO A TRAP DOOR

dialogue.raw_text: : 4    OMITTED                                                     4 THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/28/90                          4. A5   INT. ATTIC - SAME TIME                                     A5 Solemn and mournful, ten-year-old Wednesday has black hair and white skin like her mother. She sits on a stool among the stored Addams' family objects, ONE END OF A STRING TIED TO HER TOOTH, THE OTHER TIED TO A TRAP DOOR. The trap door is flung open, GRANNY pokes her head through. She's a giggly hag who looks like she was in the bathtub when the hairdryer fell in. Wednesday's pulled tooth swings at the end of the string.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 5    OMITTED                                                    5 A6   INT. GOMEZ AND MORTICIA'S BEDROOM - SAME TIME
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He kisses his way up to her neck, then, suddenly bursting with enthusiasm and a sense of purpose, LEAPS from the bed, drawing his bedside saber from its sheath and BRANDISHING it at the offending beam.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 6    EXT. ROOFTOP - SAME TIME                                   6 Granny delivers a swift kick to her fog machine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 7    INT./EXT. MORTICIA AND GOMEZ'S BEDROOM - SAME TIME
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: the fog machine hurtles downwards, missing decapitating Gomez by millimeters. It crashes below, smashing through the front porch roof.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 8   OMITTED                                                    8 9   INT. ENTRANCE HALL - LATER                                 9 Standing beside the front door is LURCH, the gigantic family butler, a reanimated stitched-together behemoth. He holds two brown paper lunch bags in his enormous hands. The bags' contents wriggle, eager to escape.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Pugsley takes his bag, opens it, and peers inside.    Lurch GROWLS, and Pugsley closes the bag.
dialogue.name: dialogue

location: BALCONY OUTSIDE GOMEZ AND MORTICIA'S BEDROOM
result.heading: EXT.

dialogue.raw_text: : 10   EXT. BALCONY OUTSIDE GOMEZ AND MORTICIA'S BEDROOM -
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 12   INT. NEIGHBOR'S HOME - SAME TIME                           12 JUDGE WOMACK, the Addams' CRUSTY PATRICIAN NEIGHBOR, is having his breakfast when Gomez's golf ball lands in his cornflakes, shattering the bowl, covering him with milk. Judge Womack hurries to his broken window, shaking his fist:
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: EXT.
location: SAME TIME 13 FROM THEIR VANTAGE POINT --

dialogue.raw_text: : 13   EXT. GOMEZ AND MORTICIA'S BALCONY - SAME TIME
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : A15   INT. CONSERVATORY - SAME TIME                              A15
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Please, Gordon, by all means - go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: SILVER PLATTER WHERE THE TWO-HEADED PIG LAY

dialogue.raw_text: : 120    EXT. PRIMEVAL FOREST ADJACENT TO CEMETERY - MIDDLE OF
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 121    EXT. NEIGHBORHOOD - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT                    121
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : 122    EXT. UNDERGROUND GROTTO - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Fester Addams!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But - this is lunacy!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fester adores Gomez!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's afraid of him. Seeing the twins brought it all back. (to Gomez) You're bitter rivals, Gomez - always were, always will be! (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/15/91                       89A. 124   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not so! Those girls meant nothing - he knows that! I demand to see Fester!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry - no can do. He's very hurt - it's not a good time. Leave it alone. Or better yet - just leave. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/22/91                          90 . 124    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wednesday comes forward, rubbing the sleep from her eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But he isn't even Uncle Fester. Gomez and Morticia turn to look at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do not fear - justic shall prevail. The courts will decide! (fervently) They say a man who represents himself has a fool for a client. Well, with God as my witness - I am that fool!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 125    OMITTED                                                     125 A126   OMITTED                                                     A126 126    INT. COURTROOM - DAY                                        126 C.U. GAVEL -- hammers on the Judge's bench. PULL BACK to reveal -- JUDGE WOMACK is the presiding judge.   He hammers the bench again, then reads his decision. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/26/91                          91 . 126   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Given applicable standards of proof, the attempts to impugn this man's character or question his identity have been woefully inadequate. It is with no small amount of personal satisfaction that I declare Fester Addams legal executor of the Addams estate and rightful owner of all properties and possessions contained herein. Gomez Addams... (He holds up a golf ball) I believe this is yours.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The family members TROOP to the car with their few possessions. GOMEZ already sits in the passenger seat of the Duesenberg, his coat draped over his shoulders as if he were an invalid, his head thrown back. Morticia carries out Cleo, her carnivorous plant. Granny carries her favorite cauldron, Wednesday one of her Marie Antoinette dolls, Pugsley his chemistry set. Lurch uproots his favorite tree and joins the procession. Thing follows, dragging a toy wagon packed with his rings, his glove.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Duesenberg eases out of the driveway and onto the street, WEIGHED DOWN by Lurch's tree, sticking out of the trunk. FESTER standing at a second story window, watches the car drive off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/28/90                          92 . 130   EXT. WAMPUM COURT - LATER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A two-story NEON ARROW points the way to this bungalow court -- Bright and awful ersatz western. LOG CABINS OF SIMULATED WOOD surround the TEEPEE-SHAPED OFFICE. The Addams' Duesenberg is parked in front of the furthest cabin. The asphalt has been ripped up in big chunks and Lurch's tree is parked next to the Addams' new home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: C.U. DRESSING TABLE MIRROR Morticia leans into frame. With an icepick and a hammer, she deftly makes a large spidery CRACK in the round mirror. Sighing deeply, she stands back to admire her handiwork. Granny joins her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like it. Her mother pats her consolingly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just as long as we're together, n'est pas, mon cher? As she turns to Gomez, we see the interior of the bungalow -- all ersatz cowboy and Indian mixed with chrome-plated plastic and orange shag carpet. GOMEZ sits slumped in a   chair made from wagon wheel and nauga- hyde. It's as if    all of his insane, vibrant energy has been leeched from   him. He's a broken man. He looks back at her as if he's   never heard French.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huh? Wednesday tends to him.    She and her mother exchange a worried look. PUGSLEY comes from the bathroom, nibbling a wrapped bar of motel soap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This place isn't so bad. They even put candy in the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the soap, dear. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/20/90                           93 . 131    CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. He takes another greedy bite. Wednesday pats her father's arm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you want a cigar, Father?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're very bad for you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Father? Wednesday exchanges a panic-stricken look with Morticia. The family moves closer to Gomez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But maybe I'll have one of those... He takes a bar of soap from Pugsley.     Gomez unwraps it and morosely eats.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 132    OMITTED                                                       132 132A   INT. ADDAMS MANSION - MIDWAY TO THE VAULT                     132A C.U. on three hands, as they reach up to pull three of the countless chains. CUT TO: A133   EXT. ADDAMS YARD - MIDNIGHT                                   A133 THE COAL CHUTE ON THE SIDE OF THE HOUSE -- drops open, dumping out Fester, Abigail, and Tully - all of them wet and bedraggled and gasping for air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're doing this on purpose. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/20/90                          94 . A133   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all struggle to their feet and march grimly back toward the door. CUT TO: 133    INT. WAMPUM COURT BUNGALOW - MORNING                         133 Gomez is STRETCHED OUT on the naked box springs of his bed -- the mattress pushed aside. A damp cloth covers his eyes. Thing MASSAGES his aching head. A bowl of MOTEL SOAPS is beside him. In contrast, Morticia squarely faces the crisis. She addresses the family from the head of the breakfast table, the want ads open on the table before her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We are Addamses, and we will not submit. Who recalls the fable of the tortoise and the hare? The swift, yet lazy little cottontail, and his slow but determined companion? What does that story teach us, as Addamses?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Kill the hare. Skin it.   Boil it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put the tortoise on the highway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: During rush hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes! We will survive! Poison us, strangle us, break our bones - we will come back for more. And why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we like it! (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/12/90                        94A. 133   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because we're Addamses! Gomez tries to rouse himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're Addamses... He burps -- soap bubbles floating from his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/28/90                           95 . 136   EXT. SIDEWALK IN FRONT OF THE WAMPUM COURT - DAY              136 Wednesday and Pugsley have set up a LEMONADE STAND, their contribution to the Addams' financial well-being. An array of POISONS are lined up on their rickety table. They've slashed their prices to a nickel per cup. The pitcher on the table before them steams. Cars speed by. Carrying a SAMPLE VACUUM CLEANER and a bucket, Lurch comes out of the motel courtyard. Pugsley offers him a cup of punch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, Lurch.   On the house. Lurch downs it in a gulp and heads off. Feeling the effects of the lemonade, Lurch BURPS -- a tongue of flame shoots from his mouth and INCINERATES A WOODEN INDIAN advertising the Wampum Court.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 137   OMITTED                                                       137 138   INT. EMPLOYMENT AGENCY                                        138 Morticia is being interviewed by a PERSONNEL OFFICER, a relentlessly perky gal with a clipboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have so many homemakers re-entering the work force - your domestic skills can be very valuable. College?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Private tutors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Major?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Spells and Hexes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Liberal Arts. Have you been a volunteer, PTA, service organizations?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, one day each week I visit Death Row at our local prison, with my children. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 4/03/91                          96 . 138   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With your children?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Autographs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, what about your husband? Is he currently employed?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's... he's going through a bad patch at the moment. But it's not his fault.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not. What is he - A loafer? A hopeless layabout? A shiftless dreamer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not anymore. The Personnel Officer shoots Morticia a doubtful glance, and begins rifling through her card file.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Abigail and Fester are seated at opposite ends of the couch. Fester stares off into space. Abigail is going through a stack of colorful travel brochures.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Mediterranean, the Riviera - once we find the money, we'll go everywhere. We'll try again, right after lunch. Gordon - where should we go first?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Acapulco? Cancun? (she snaps her fingers in the air, castanet- style, trying to be festive) Ariba! Ariba!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You choose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 4/03/91                         A96A. A140   EXT. WAMPUM COURT - LATER THAT DAY                      A140 Wednesday and Pugsley are at their lemonade stand. They are negotiating with a PRISSY LITTLE GIRL IN A GIRL SCOUT UNIFORM. The girl scout carries several boxes of Girl Scout cookies.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this made from real lemons?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I only like all-natural foods and beverages. Organically grown, with no preservatives. Are you sure they're real lemons?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/26/91                          96A. A140   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well... I   tell you what. I'll buy a cup, if   you buy a box of my delicious   girl scout cookies. Do we have a   deal?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are they made from real girl scouts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: White clapboard. Geraniums in the flower boxes. Surrounded by a white picket fence. Carrying his SAMPLE VACUUM CLEANER AND BUCKET, the tools of his new trade, Lurch carefully opens the little white gate. AT THE DOOR, he rings the doorbell, afraid he might break something. A BLONDE HOUSEWIFE in tennis whites, obviously in a hurry, opens the door -- only to be greeted by a BUCKETFUL OF SLOP thrown past her, onto her peach Oriental rug. She SCREAMS in horror, turns to challenge the perpetrator of this atrocity and, seeing Lurch, SCREAMS again. In a panic, she tries to slam the door on Lurch, but, like the salesman's manual undoubtedly advised, he STICKS his foot in the way. The door partially RIPS off its hinges. Lurch steps inside and shuts the door as best he can. A moment passes. The door swings open and Lurch exits, jauntily waving a check.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - 2/22/91                         97 . 144   INT. DAYCARE CENTER - DAY                                  144 Morticia is telling a story to a group of TODDLERS, who have gathered in a circle around her, sitting on carpet squares. The room is sunny and cheerful, with crayon drawings taped to the walls.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... and so the witch lured Hansel and Gretel into the candy house, by promising them more sweets. And she told them to look in the oven, and she was about to push them in, when, low and behold, Hansel pushed the poor, defenseless witch into the oven instead. Where she was burned alive, writhing in agony. Now, boys and girls, what do you think that feels like? After a beat, all the toddlers begin to CRY and WAIL.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/20/90                        98 . 145    OMITTED                                                    145 thru                                                              thru 147
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thru                                                              thru 152    OMITTED                                                    152 A153   EXT. WAMPUN BUNGALOW - DAY                                 A153 Granny holds a club behind her back as she stalks something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here kitty, kitty, kitty...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Eating compulsively form a box of Mallomars, Gomez is still stretched out on the naked box springs. He stares vacantly at a game show on TV. "Jeopardy" is on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Monsters Of History for $200. "He was known as the Butcher of Bavaria."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Grandfather Addams! (smacks his forehead, hard) Damn! Not in the form of a question!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Granny, running now, club raised, hurries past the open window of the bungalow. She stops at the sight of Gomez inside, standing on the bed, staring at the television. C.U. on the TV set - Gomez is now watching Geraldo Rivera, hosting his tabloid style show.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Voodoo zombies - the stuff of legend, or a living nightmare? Do zombies really exist? How are they made? Where can we find them? Call in with your comments. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/20/90                           99 . A154   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is flashed on the screen.    Gomez reaches for the phone. CUT TO: 154    INT. ADDAMS MANSION DINING ROOM - DAY                         154 Abigail and Gordon are seated at opposite ends of the table, having lunch. It is very quiet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: After lunch, we'll try again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll find the money. And meanwhile, we have this little nest. Quiet and cozy. Without that dreadful family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mother.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just the two of us, away from the world. Our dream come true.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, Mother. As Fester repeats "Yes, Mother", in his drone, Abigail mimics him, silently.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : A155   INT. BUNGALOW - AN HOUR LATER                                 A155 C.U. on the TV screen.   Geraldo is talking to a woman in the studio audience.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So your son was brainwashed by voodoo slave masters and forced to recruit others. Let's take a call.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Geraldo...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Addams, please stop calling. We don't know where they meet. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/20/90                          100. A155   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: to the motel room. Gomez lets the phone drop. Morticia, seated on the edge of the box spring, tries to comfort him. Pugsley, Wednesday and Lurch are seated nearby, very worried about Gomez, as at a death watch. Gomez is now surrounded by junk food, and a mountain of junk food wrappers, bags and styrofoam containers. Ritually, as handmaidens, Morticia brings Gomez the remote control for the TV, and Wednesday brings him a copy of TV Guide. Pugsley brings Gomez a bag of "Doritos", and Lurch brings him a canister of "Pringles". Gomez uses the remote to switch channels.   An episode of "The Cosby Show" comes on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Re-run. He switches off the set and stares at the blank screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't understand. All he does is watch TV and eat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know - Gomez, let's go for a drive. The whole family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A drive? And miss "Matlock"? Granny opens the door and sticks her head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dinner's going to be late. She slams the door.   We hear her whistling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, boy.   Here, boy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : 128   OMITTED                                                     128 129   EXT. ADDAMS OVERGROWN DRIVEWAY - LATER                      129
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: EXT.
location: SIDEWALK IN FRONT OF THE WAMPUM COURT

result.heading: PRISSY LITTLE GIRL IN A GIRL SCOUT UNIFORM
143 A144 OMITTED A144 B144 OMITTED B144 THE ADDAMS FAMILY

dialogue.raw_text: : A154   EXT. BUNGALOW - SAME TIME                                  A154
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - 2/7/91                            100A. A155A   INT. WAMPUM COURT - LATER                                 A155A* Morticia is putting Wednesday to bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If that man isn't Uncle Fester, then who is he, mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, darling.   I wish I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why is that lady doing all this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's hard to say. Sometimes people have had terrible childhoods. And sometimes they just haven't found their special place in life. And sometimes they're dogs from hell and must be destroyed. Morticia kisses Wednesday and she closes her eyes to go to sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - 4/03/91                           101. B155    INT. WAMPUM - MIDDLE OF THE NIGHT                        B155 The family sleeps - all but Morticia. She sits up in bed beside Gomez. She looks around at her family. Wednesday sleeps in the same bed as Granny. Lurch is flat out on the floor. Pugsley uses him for a mattress, and Thing uses Pugsley. Pugsley snores the inhale part of a snore, Lurch groans the exhale part, and Thing punctuates by wiggling. Morticia stares down at Gomez - for a long beat. She strokes his hair lovingly. Full of resolve, she gets out of bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fester is lying in bed, the covers around his chin. Abigail sits on the bed beside him, tucking him in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know why you've been so glum. It's because it's taking us a little longer than we'd hoped to find the gold. Isn't that right? Fester turns away, depressed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course it is. Well, don't you worry - we're right on the verge. Tomorrow, for certain, my darling. (she kisses him on the forehead, and stands. She goes to the door, and turns) You know, some people might think it's strange, for a mother and son to be so close. I think it's beautiful. Don't you, Gordon? Fester mumbles something, under his breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, mother. It's beautiful. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: : AC155   INT. FESTER'S BEDROOM - NIGHT                            AC155*
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - 4/03/91                         102. AC155   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look - I'm weeping. Abigail exits. The minute the door shuts, Fester gets out of bed. He is fully clothed. He goes to the window, and begins to climb out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morticia, fully dressed, wearing her cloak, heads off down the walk. Unseen by her, Thing trails after.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morticia, just outside Gate, struggles to get it open, Thing clutching the bars, also attempting to block her way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop it, you two. Morticia breaks free of Thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tully opens the front door. He smiles maliciously at the sight of Morticia on the stoop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I would like to speak with Fester. Tully steps aside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've been expecting you... Morticia crosses the threshold.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/19/91                         103. 155   EXT. INTERSECTION AT THE FOOT OF THE ADDAMS HILL - NIGHT 155 Thing does his damnedest to flag down any of the few oncoming cars. He waves to no avail, DANCES AROUND in frustration, then tries HITCHHIKING, sticking out his thumb. A passing car splashes him with mud. Screwing up his courage, in a kamikaze leap, he GRABS ahold of the bumper of the next car that comes along and hangs on for dear life as the car SPEEDS down the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morticia is now stretched out on the torture RACK. Fester and Tully are securing her hands and feet, under Abigail's supervision. Fester seems torn, agitated, upset.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are a desperate woman, consumed by greed and infinite bitterness. (a beat) We could have been such friends.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think so. The vault, Mrs. Addams - any thoughts?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Despite everything, I don't hate you. I pity you. Persecution, fiendish torture, inhuman depravity - sometimes it's just not enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon - let's get started.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, Mother...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop stalling!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not stalling! Stop badgering me!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tully, take over! Tighten it! (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/19/91                           103A. 156   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd love to, you know that, but - I've got this stomach thing. When I torture people. It's just me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do it!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's your bathroom?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! Tully shuts his eyes and tightens the rack. Morticia's bones make a horrible POPPING, STRETCHING SOUND. She MOANS, rather sensually.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again! Tully tightens the rack again. More BONE-POPPING NOISES. Morticia MOANS again, even more orgasmically.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tighter! Tully tightens the rack a third time. BONE-POPPING NOISES. Morticia MOANS, very voluptuously. She opens her eyes. She sighs, in afterglow. She glances at Tully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You've done this before.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/19/91                            104. 157   EXT. WAMPUM COURT - NIGHT                                  157 A hand possessed, Thing RACES up the driveway, raising dust as he goes. 158   EXT. BUNGALOW - NIGHT                                      158 Thing leaps dramatically onto the porch, then stops dead to knock on the cabin door. After a beat:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is it?     We're paid through Thursday. He opens the door.    Thing rushes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : 159   INT. BUNGALOW - MINUTES LATER                              159 Thing skitters on the kitchen counter, frantically signing. In the background, the rest of the family sleeps. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/26/91                           105. 159   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slow down, Thing! It's terrible when you stutter! Frustrated, Thing grabs a SPOON and begins tapping out MORSE CODE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morticia in danger... stop!    Send help at once ... stop! Thing flops down in exhausted triumph.    Gomez grabs him and heads off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morticia is now lashed to an ENORMOUS TORTURE WHEEL. Tully and Abigail are tending the stick BRANDING IRONS stuck in the roaring fire.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You can't! Not with red-hot pokers!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is this gonna smell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tully Alford - charlatan. Deadbeat. Parasite. How Gomez adored you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, not enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morticia, please...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dear Fester - or whomever you are. Which is the real you - the loathsome, under-handed monster you've become? Or the loathsome, underhanded monster we came to love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't ask me... (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 4/03/91                         105A. 161   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fester - I saw you tonight, at my window. I know it was you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was... restless! I couldn't sleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gordon, I have a thought. Just a notion, top of my head. Tell me what you think. Since you and Mrs. Addams are so very close... Abigail takes a red-hot POKER out of the fire and hands it to Fester.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... be my guest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/17/90                          106. 162    OMITTED                                                   162 thru                                                             thru 164
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DUESENBERG - NIGHT                                   A165 Gomez cuts the engine. The car glides silently through Gate -- who opens uncharacteristically without a creak. Gomez stops the car and skulks out. Thing skulks after him. Gomez sees the reflections of the roaring fire through the study window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Fester takes the poker and approaches Morticia - GOMEZ CRASHES THROUGH THE WINDOW, in a back-flip. Thing JUDO-FLIPS in after Gomez. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/15/91                            107. 165   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cara mia!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mon cher!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Addams! Thing tosses Gomez a saber off the study wall. Tully also grabs a saber, and approaches Gomez from behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darling, take care! Without even looking, Gomez parries Tully's blow from behind. Then he whirls on Tully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dirty pool, old man.      Never again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is for keeps, Gomez!      Not just doubloons! Tully feints, then slashes - shredding the front of Gomez's jacket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One for you, Tully, and... Gomez ATTACKS - HIS BLADE FLASHING LIKE LIGHTNING. In a blur of action, Tully's sword is knocked from his hand and he's sent tumbling backwards, finally landing on his knees.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... one for me! Tully looks up at Gomez with cowardly, pleading eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gomez... it's Tully. I'm your lawyer. I'm on retainer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let him up! Gomez turns to see... (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 12/3/90                              108. 165   CONTINUED:    (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - who now has a pistol aimed at Morticia.       One shot and Morticia will die horribly. Gomez throws aside his sword.      Tully scrambles to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's right! Now get moving - Addams, take him to the vault. And if you're not back in one hour... (the pistol aimed at Morticia, and using her accent) I displace her. Gomez is near enough now to take Morticia's hand, on the torture wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tish - seeing you like this.   My blood boils.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As does mine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This wheel of pain...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our wheel. CU on Fester, confused at watching this emotional display.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To live without you - only that would be torture. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/15/91                            109. 165   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A day alone - only that would be death. Gomez kisses Morticia's hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Knock it off!    The vault, Addams - right now!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, Mother can't we... Gomez reaches for the book that will open the secret panel:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can it, Gordon! Stop dragging your feet! You disgust me - you're nothing but a useless, snivelling baby! A stone around my neck! What was I thinking - I should've left you where I found you! At Abigail's final words, Fester suddenly LEAPS FORWARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No tricks, Gomez! That's the wrong book! CLOSE UP Gomez's hand is on the right book, "Greed," but Fester stops him from pulling it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Allow me... Gomez looks into Fester's eyes -- realizing what he's about to do.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good show, old man... Fester reaches for a DIFFERENT BOOK -- "Hurricane Irene: Nightmare from Above." Seeing the title of the book, Tully suddenly panics: (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 3/18/91                          110. 165   CONTINUED:   (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put that book down, Gordon! You don't know what it can do! It's not just literture!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, really?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm your friend, Gordon - think of the doubloons!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're not yours, Tully!     Back off! ANGLE on Gomez, releasing Morticia from the torture wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quickly, my darling! He helps her down from the wheel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leather straps, red-hot pokers...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Later, my dearest. ANGLE on Fester, facing off with Abigail, as Tully cowers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep the book closed, Gordon - listen to mother!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll never listen to you - not ever again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had to be strict with you - because I cared! Put it down!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You never really loved me! ANGLE on Gomez and Morticia, nearing the bookcase.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, my love - to safety!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But what of Fester? (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/28/91                          110A. 165    CONTINUED:   (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old man, this way! ANGLE on Abigail and Fester.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stop whining, you little good- for-nothing! Be a man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're a terrible mother!   There, I said it! Fester opens the book, and blasts Tully out of the window. Then he blasts Abigail out as well. ANGLE ON GOMEZ, who has now pulled the right book, "Greed", to open the bookshelf. Amid the storm, he is leading Morticia behind the bookshelf. He tries to hold the bookshelf open for Fester to follow, fighting the gale force winds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Old man! This way! ANGLE ON THING, across the room, struggling across the floor toward the bookshelf. Thing fights the wind, which pelts him with papers and other flying debris. Gomez can no longer fight the storm, and the bookshelf slams shut. Fester desperately tries to close the book to quell the storm, but a HUGE BOLT OF LIGHTNING ZAPS HIM. He falls to the floor, with electricity coursing through him. MOVE IN on the storm raging within the pages of the book, then - FADE TO BLACK FADE IN ON: 166    OMITTED                                                   166 thru                                                             thru 169
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: thru                                                             thru 173                                                              173 THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/28/91                           110B. 174   EXT. ADDAMS MANSION, NEXT OCTOBER - NIGHT                174 A group of little CHILDREN approach the front door. There is a hand-lettered sign on the door reading "HALLOWEEN OPEN HOUSE." The children are dressed in traditional Halloween costumes - there's a witch, a ghost, a skeleton, etc., and they all carry trick-or-treat bags. They giggle and chatter. One of the children is pushed forward, and he KNOCKS on the front door. As the door opens, the children CHANT:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trick or... They freeze in mid-chant. We do not see who has opened the door, but the children do. After a beat, they SCREAM IN HORROR and run, terrified, back toward the street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 12/3/90                           111. 175   INT. FRONT HALL - SAME TIME                               175 Lurch is closing the front door, looking puzzled. The family is busily decorating the house for their annual Halloween festivities. All the decorations are elegant yet ancient, dusty and faded. The crystal gloves in the chandeliers have been replaced by miniature jack o- lanterns. Skeletons, each wearing a top hat, hang from the sconces by the nooses around their necks. There are clusters of black and orange balloons, covered with cobwebs. Uncle Fester and Thing are draping the banisters and stairway railings with a garland made from crepe paper, dead branches and spanish moss. Skulls, each holding a candle, are scattered about, on the stairs and the furniture. A stuffed, life-size scarecrow leans against the stairway, with a pitchfork through its throat. A banner on the wall reads "HAPPY HALLOWEEN", and the letters drip with blood. Gomez hangs upside down from the balcony.   Morticia hands him a decoration. Granny appears from the kitchen, carrying a tray of food.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, it's their loss. I even made finger sandwiches. Perched on Fester's shoulder, Thing shakes in fear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, calm down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here we come! Wednesday and Pugsley come down the stairs. Wednesday is dressed in her usual style, but Pugsley is dressed as a tiny version of UNCLE FESTER, COMPLETE WITH BALD HEAD AND GREATCOAT. The adults are delighted. Gomez flips down onto his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pugsley, old man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How do you like it? Fester is very touched; he picks Pugsley up. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/15/91                         111A. 175   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What can I say? He's going to break hearts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's get a picture!     Lurch?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes - in the den. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 11/20/90                           112. 175   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Everyone starts to move toward the den. There is a KNOCK on the door. Everyone turns. Lurch opens the door. Standing outside are Margaret and Cousin It. Margaret is dressed as a fairy princess, complete with wand. Cousin It wears a cowboy hat, a bandanna and a holster. Margaret is radiant, obviously very much in love.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trick or treat!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooot oot glibber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look, everyone! We have guests!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Margaret. Cousin It - I almost didn't recognize you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't he handsome? Everyone keeps asking where he bought his costume.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a wonderful hat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what are you, darling?   Where's your costume?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my costume. I'm a homicidal maniac. They look just like everyone else.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fester and Pugsley are posed at one end of the room. Lurch has set up an easel and canvas; he is painting Fester and Pugsley's portrait. Gomez and Wednesday are sitting on the floor amid newspapers, carving a pumpkin. Morticia is knitting. Margaret and Cousin It sit together, holding hands. Granny brings people cups of steaming punch, from a punch bowl. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/19/91                          113. 176   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Halloween - it's such a special time. Ghosts and goblins. Witches on broomsticks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Children begging in the streets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm so glad I can share this night with my family - my real family. Now that I've got my memory back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That unfortunate woman. Filled with evil. (shaking her head, sadly) But not enough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wasn't your mother.     She just said that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooot oot gleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You remember, old sport - she really did find him tangled in a tuna net, twenty-five years ago. With amnesia.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the Bermuda Triangle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooot oot oot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How true.   Stranger things have happened.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sorry, and I'm not bitter, but I blame Tully.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooot blipper gleep.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, stop. I'm blushing. (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/19/91                       113A. 176   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank God for that lightning. Knocked some sense into you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Please, Uncle Fester?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pugsley... (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 2/19/91                             114. 176   CONTINUED:   (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For the picture? Fester pops a light bulb into his mouth.   It lights. Pugsley giggles. Gomez stands up, having finished the pumpkin. He places it on a table, and lights the candle inside. The pumpkin glows. It has ONE EYE IN THE MIDDLE OF ITS FOREHEAD. Everyone oohs and ahhs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know, all the old sayings are true. There's no place like home. And blood is thicker than water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And just as refreshing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right, everybody - time for a game! What shall it be - bobbing for apples?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charades?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooot glibber glip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course - "Wake The Dead."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Wake The Dead"!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: "Wake The Dead"! Out to the cemetery! Come on, everyone! Everyone starts to exit, chattering happily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've never played this before - how does it go?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you bring a shovel? (CONTINUED) THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 3/18/91                            114A. 176   CONTINUED:   (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uncle Fester, will you be on my team?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, mine!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you what - we'll give you a head start. Three skulls and a pelvis - how's that? Pugsley and Wednesday cheer and run out.   Fester faces Gomez.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My own dear brother - who could be more precious?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Blood is thicker than water, old man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And just as refreshing. Gomez offers his hand.   Fester takes it, in a manly handshake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let us never be parted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let us always be as one. Fester flips Gomez in a JUDO FLIP. Gomez LANDS - At the foot of a glass display case. The camera pans up the case. It contains ABIGAIL AND TULLY, EXPERTLY MOUNTED AND STUFFED. Fester rises, dusting himself off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We'll catch up. Fester runs out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: THE ADDAMS FAMILY - 3/18/91                           115-117. 177   OMITTED                                                    177 178   INT. FRONT HALL                                            178 Everyone is gone. Morticia and Gomez have drifted into the front hall; they are moving toward the front door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Our family... what are they?
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (instantly very sweet, dabbing her eye with a fingertip)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : D155    EXT. GATE - A LITTLE LATER                               D155
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: : E155    EXT. ADDAMS MANSION - A LITTLE LATER                     E155
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: EXT.
location: INTERSECTION AT THE FOOT OF THE ADDAMS HILL

dialogue.raw_text: : 160   OMITTED                                                     160 161   INT. GOMEZ'S STUDY - A FEW MINUTES LATER                    161
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: HUGE BOLT OF LIGHTNING ZAPS HIM
